text_entry: Judas Maccabaeus; this swain, because of his great

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: limb or joint, shall pass Pompey the Great; the

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: page, Hercules,--

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Pardon, sir; error: he is not quantity enough for

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: that Worthy's thumb: he is not so big as the end of his club.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Shall I have audience? he shall present Hercules in

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: minority: his enter and exit shall be strangling a

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: snake; and I will have an apology for that purpose.

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: An excellent device! so, if any of the audience

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: hiss, you may cry 'Well done, Hercules! now thou

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: crushest the snake!' that is the way to make an

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: offence gracious, though few have the grace to do it.

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: For the rest of the Worthies?--

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: I will play three myself.

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: Thrice-worthy gentleman!

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Shall I tell you a thing?

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: We attend.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: We will have, if this fadge not, an antique. I

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: beseech you, follow.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Via, goodman Dull! thou hast spoken no word all this while.

speaker: DULL
text_entry: Nor understood none neither, sir.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Allons! we will employ thee.

speaker: DULL
text_entry: I'll make one in a dance, or so; or I will play

speaker: DULL
text_entry: On the tabour to the Worthies, and let them dance the hay.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Most dull, honest Dull! To our sport, away!

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: LOVE'S LABOURS LOST

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: SCENE II. The same.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Enter the PRINCESS, KATHARINE, ROSALINE, and MARIA

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Sweet hearts, we shall be rich ere we depart,

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: If fairings come thus plentifully in:

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: A lady wall'd about with diamonds!

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Look you what I have from the loving king.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Madame, came nothing else along with that?

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Nothing but this! yes, as much love in rhyme

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: As would be cramm'd up in a sheet of paper,

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Writ o' both sides the leaf, margent and all,

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: That he was fain to seal on Cupid's name.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: That was the way to make his godhead wax,

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: For he hath been five thousand years a boy.

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: Ay, and a shrewd unhappy gallows too.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: You'll ne'er be friends with him; a' kill'd your sister.

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: He made her melancholy, sad, and heavy;

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: And so she died: had she been light, like you,

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: Of such a merry, nimble, stirring spirit,

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: She might ha' been a grandam ere she died:

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: And so may you; for a light heart lives long.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: What's your dark meaning, mouse, of this light word?

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: A light condition in a beauty dark.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: We need more light to find your meaning out.

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: You'll mar the light by taking it in snuff;

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: Therefore I'll darkly end the argument.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Look what you do, you do it still i' the dark.

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: So do not you, for you are a light wench.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Indeed I weigh not you, and therefore light.

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: You weigh me not? O, that's you care not for me.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Great reason; for 'past cure is still past care.'

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Well bandied both; a set of wit well play'd.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: But Rosaline, you have a favour too:

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Who sent it? and what is it?

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: I would you knew:

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: An if my face were but as fair as yours,

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: My favour were as great; be witness this.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Nay, I have verses too, I thank Biron:

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: The numbers true; and, were the numbering too,

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: I were the fairest goddess on the ground:

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: I am compared to twenty thousand fairs.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: O, he hath drawn my picture in his letter!

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Any thing like?

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Much in the letters; nothing in the praise.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Beauteous as ink; a good conclusion.

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: Fair as a text B in a copy-book.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: 'Ware pencils, ho! let me not die your debtor,

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: My red dominical, my golden letter:

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: O, that your face were not so full of O's!

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: A pox of that jest! and I beshrew all shrows.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: But, Katharine, what was sent to you from fair Dumain?

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: Madam, this glove.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Did he not send you twain?

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: Yes, madam, and moreover

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: Some thousand verses of a faithful lover,

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: A huge translation of hypocrisy,

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: Vilely compiled, profound simplicity.

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: This and these pearls to me sent Longaville:

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: The letter is too long by half a mile.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: I think no less. Dost thou not wish in heart

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: The chain were longer and the letter short?

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Ay, or I would these hands might never part.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: We are wise girls to mock our lovers so.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: They are worse fools to purchase mocking so.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: That same Biron I'll torture ere I go:

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: O that I knew he were but in by the week!

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: How I would make him fawn and beg and seek

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: And wait the season and observe the times

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: And spend his prodigal wits in bootless rhymes

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: And shape his service wholly to my hests

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: And make him proud to make me proud that jests!

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: So perttaunt-like would I o'ersway his state

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: That he should be my fool and I his fate.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: None are so surely caught, when they are catch'd,

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: As wit turn'd fool: folly, in wisdom hatch'd,

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Hath wisdom's warrant and the help of school

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: And wit's own grace to grace a learned fool.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: The blood of youth burns not with such excess

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: As gravity's revolt to wantonness.

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Folly in fools bears not so strong a note

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: As foolery in the wise, when wit doth dote;

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Since all the power thereof it doth apply

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: To prove, by wit, worth in simplicity.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Here comes Boyet, and mirth is in his face.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Enter BOYET

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: O, I am stabb'd with laughter! Where's her grace?

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Thy news Boyet?

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Prepare, madam, prepare!

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Arm, wenches, arm! encounters mounted are

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Against your peace: Love doth approach disguised,

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Armed in arguments; you'll be surprised:

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Muster your wits; stand in your own defence;

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Or hide your heads like cowards, and fly hence.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Saint Denis to Saint Cupid! What are they

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: That charge their breath against us? say, scout, say.

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Under the cool shade of a sycamore

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: I thought to close mine eyes some half an hour;

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: When, lo! to interrupt my purposed rest,

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Toward that shade I might behold addrest

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: The king and his companions: warily

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: I stole into a neighbour thicket by,

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: And overheard what you shall overhear,

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: That, by and by, disguised they will be here.

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Their herald is a pretty knavish page,

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: That well by heart hath conn'd his embassage:

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Action and accent did they teach him there;

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: 'Thus must thou speak,' and 'thus thy body bear:'

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: And ever and anon they made a doubt

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Presence majestical would put him out,

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: 'For,' quoth the king, 'an angel shalt thou see;

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Yet fear not thou, but speak audaciously.'

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: The boy replied, 'An angel is not evil;

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: I should have fear'd her had she been a devil.'

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: With that, all laugh'd and clapp'd him on the shoulder,

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Making the bold wag by their praises bolder:

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: One rubb'd his elbow thus, and fleer'd and swore

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: A better speech was never spoke before;

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Another, with his finger and his thumb,

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Cried, 'Via! we will do't, come what will come;'

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: The third he caper'd, and cried, 'All goes well;'

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: The fourth turn'd on the toe, and down he fell.

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: With that, they all did tumble on the ground,

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: With such a zealous laughter, so profound,

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: That in this spleen ridiculous appears,

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: To cheque their folly, passion's solemn tears.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: But what, but what, come they to visit us?

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: They do, they do: and are apparell'd thus.

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Like Muscovites or Russians, as I guess.

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Their purpose is to parle, to court and dance;

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: And every one his love-feat will advance

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Unto his several mistress, which they'll know

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: By favours several which they did bestow.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: And will they so? the gallants shall be task'd;

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: For, ladies, we shall every one be mask'd;

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: And not a man of them shall have the grace,

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Despite of suit, to see a lady's face.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Hold, Rosaline, this favour thou shalt wear,

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: And then the king will court thee for his dear;

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Hold, take thou this, my sweet, and give me thine,

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: So shall Biron take me for Rosaline.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: And change your favours too; so shall your loves

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Woo contrary, deceived by these removes.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Come on, then; wear the favours most in sight.

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: But in this changing what is your intent?

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: The effect of my intent is to cross theirs:

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: They do it but in mocking merriment;

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: And mock for mock is only my intent.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Their several counsels they unbosom shall

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: To loves mistook, and so be mock'd withal

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Upon the next occasion that we meet,

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: With visages displayed, to talk and greet.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: But shall we dance, if they desire to't?

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: No, to the death, we will not move a foot;

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Nor to their penn'd speech render we no grace,

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: But while 'tis spoke each turn away her face.

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Why, that contempt will kill the speaker's heart,

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: And quite divorce his memory from his part.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Therefore I do it; and I make no doubt

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: The rest will ne'er come in, if he be out

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: There's no such sport as sport by sport o'erthrown,

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: To make theirs ours and ours none but our own:

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: So shall we stay, mocking intended game,

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: And they, well mock'd, depart away with shame.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Trumpets sound within

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: The trumpet sounds: be mask'd; the maskers come.

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: The Ladies mask

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Enter Blackamoors with music; MOTH; FERDINAND,  BIRON, LONGAVILLE, and DUMAIN, in Russian habits, and masked

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: All hail, the richest beauties on the earth!--

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Beauties no richer than rich taffeta.

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: A holy parcel of the fairest dames.

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: The Ladies turn their backs to him

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: That ever turn'd their--backs--to mortal views!

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: [Aside to MOTH]  Their eyes, villain, their eyes!

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: That ever turn'd their eyes to mortal views!--Out--

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: True; out indeed.

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: Out of your favours, heavenly spirits, vouchsafe

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: Not to behold--

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: [Aside to MOTH]  Once to behold, rogue.

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: Once to behold with your sun-beamed eyes,

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: --with your sun-beamed eyes--

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: They will not answer to that epithet;

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: You were best call it 'daughter-beamed eyes.'

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: They do not mark me, and that brings me out.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Is this your perfectness? be gone, you rogue!

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Exit MOTH

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: What would these strangers? know their minds, Boyet:

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: If they do speak our language, 'tis our will:

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: That some plain man recount their purposes

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Know what they would.

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: What would you with the princess?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Nothing but peace and gentle visitation.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: What would they, say they?

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Nothing but peace and gentle visitation.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Why, that they have; and bid them so be gone.

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: She says, you have it, and you may be gone.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Say to her, we have measured many miles

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: To tread a measure with her on this grass.

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: They say, that they have measured many a mile

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: To tread a measure with you on this grass.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: It is not so. Ask them how many inches

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Is in one mile: if they have measured many,

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: The measure then of one is easily told.

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: If to come hither you have measured miles,

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: And many miles, the princess bids you tell

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: How many inches doth fill up one mile.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Tell her, we measure them by weary steps.

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: She hears herself.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: How many weary steps,

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Of many weary miles you have o'ergone,

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Are number'd in the travel of one mile?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: We number nothing that we spend for you:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Our duty is so rich, so infinite,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: That we may do it still without accompt.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Vouchsafe to show the sunshine of your face,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: That we, like savages, may worship it.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: My face is but a moon, and clouded too.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Blessed are clouds, to do as such clouds do!

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Vouchsafe, bright moon, and these thy stars, to shine,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Those clouds removed, upon our watery eyne.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: O vain petitioner! beg a greater matter;

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Thou now request'st but moonshine in the water.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Then, in our measure do but vouchsafe one change.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Thou bid'st me beg: this begging is not strange.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Play, music, then! Nay, you must do it soon.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Music plays

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Not yet! no dance! Thus change I like the moon.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Will you not dance? How come you thus estranged?

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: You took the moon at full, but now she's changed.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Yet still she is the moon, and I the man.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: The music plays; vouchsafe some motion to it.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Our ears vouchsafe it.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: But your legs should do it.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Since you are strangers and come here by chance,

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: We'll not be nice: take hands. We will not dance.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Why take we hands, then?

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Only to part friends:

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Curtsy, sweet hearts; and so the measure ends.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: More measure of this measure; be not nice.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: We can afford no more at such a price.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Prize you yourselves: what buys your company?

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Your absence only.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: That can never be.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Then cannot we be bought: and so, adieu;

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Twice to your visor, and half once to you.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: If you deny to dance, let's hold more chat.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: In private, then.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: I am best pleased with that.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: They converse apart

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: White-handed mistress, one sweet word with thee.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Honey, and milk, and sugar; there is three.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Nay then, two treys, and if you grow so nice,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Metheglin, wort, and malmsey: well run, dice!

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: There's half-a-dozen sweets.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Seventh sweet, adieu:

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Since you can cog, I'll play no more with you.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: One word in secret.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Let it not be sweet.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Thou grievest my gall.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Gall! bitter.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Therefore meet.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: They converse apart

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Will you vouchsafe with me to change a word?

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Name it.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Fair lady,--

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Say you so? Fair lord,--

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Take that for your fair lady.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Please it you,

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: As much in private, and I'll bid adieu.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: They converse apart

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: What, was your vizard made without a tongue?

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: I know the reason, lady, why you ask.

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: O for your reason! quickly, sir; I long.

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: You have a double tongue within your mask,

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: And would afford my speechless vizard half.

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: Veal, quoth the Dutchman. Is not 'veal' a calf?

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: A calf, fair lady!

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: No, a fair lord calf.

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: Let's part the word.

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: No, I'll not be your half

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: Take all, and wean it; it may prove an ox.

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: Look, how you butt yourself in these sharp mocks!

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: Will you give horns, chaste lady? do not so.

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: Then die a calf, before your horns do grow.

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: One word in private with you, ere I die.

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: Bleat softly then; the butcher hears you cry.

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: They converse apart

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: The tongues of mocking wenches are as keen

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: As is the razor's edge invisible,

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Cutting a smaller hair than may be seen,

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Above the sense of sense; so sensible

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Seemeth their conference; their conceits have wings

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Fleeter than arrows, bullets, wind, thought, swifter things.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Not one word more, my maids; break off, break off.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: By heaven, all dry-beaten with pure scoff!

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Farewell, mad wenches; you have simple wits.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Twenty adieus, my frozen Muscovits.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Exeunt FERDINAND, Lords, and Blackamoors

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Are these the breed of wits so wonder'd at?

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Tapers they are, with your sweet breaths puff'd out.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Well-liking wits they have; gross, gross; fat, fat.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: O poverty in wit, kingly-poor flout!

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Will they not, think you, hang themselves tonight?

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Or ever, but in vizards, show their faces?

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: This pert Biron was out of countenance quite.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: O, they were all in lamentable cases!

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: The king was weeping-ripe for a good word.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Biron did swear himself out of all suit.

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Dumain was at my service, and his sword:

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: No point, quoth I; my servant straight was mute.

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: Lord Longaville said, I came o'er his heart;

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: And trow you what he called me?

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Qualm, perhaps.

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: Yes, in good faith.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Go, sickness as thou art!

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Well, better wits have worn plain statute-caps.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: But will you hear? the king is my love sworn.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: And quick Biron hath plighted faith to me.

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: And Longaville was for my service born.

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Dumain is mine, as sure as bark on tree.

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Madam, and pretty mistresses, give ear:

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Immediately they will again be here

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: In their own shapes; for it can never be

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: They will digest this harsh indignity.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Will they return?

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: They will, they will, God knows,

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: And leap for joy, though they are lame with blows:

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Therefore change favours; and, when they repair,

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Blow like sweet roses in this summer air.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: How blow? how blow? speak to be understood.

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Fair ladies mask'd are roses in their bud;

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Dismask'd, their damask sweet commixture shown,

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Are angels vailing clouds, or roses blown.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Avaunt, perplexity! What shall we do,

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: If they return in their own shapes to woo?

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Good madam, if by me you'll be advised,

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Let's, mock them still, as well known as disguised:

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Let us complain to them what fools were here,

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Disguised like Muscovites, in shapeless gear;

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: And wonder what they were and to what end

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Their shallow shows and prologue vilely penn'd

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: And their rough carriage so ridiculous,

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Should be presented at our tent to us.

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Ladies, withdraw: the gallants are at hand.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Whip to our tents, as roes run o'er land.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Exeunt PRINCESS, ROSALINE, KATHARINE, and MARIA

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Re-enter FERDINAND, BIRON, LONGAVILLE, and DUMAIN, in their proper habits

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Fair sir, God save you! Where's the princess?

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Gone to her tent. Please it your majesty

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Command me any service to her thither?

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: That she vouchsafe me audience for one word.

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: I will; and so will she, I know, my lord.

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Exit

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: This fellow pecks up wit as pigeons pease,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And utters it again when God doth please:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: He is wit's pedler, and retails his wares

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: At wakes and wassails, meetings, markets, fairs;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And we that sell by gross, the Lord doth know,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Have not the grace to grace it with such show.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: This gallant pins the wenches on his sleeve;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Had he been Adam, he had tempted Eve;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: A' can carve too, and lisp: why, this is he

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: That kiss'd his hand away in courtesy;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: This is the ape of form, monsieur the nice,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: That, when he plays at tables, chides the dice

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: In honourable terms: nay, he can sing

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: A mean most meanly; and in ushering

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Mend him who can: the ladies call him sweet;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: The stairs, as he treads on them, kiss his feet:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: This is the flower that smiles on every one,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: To show his teeth as white as whale's bone;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And consciences, that will not die in debt,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Pay him the due of honey-tongued Boyet.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: A blister on his sweet tongue, with my heart,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: That put Armado's page out of his part!

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: See where it comes! Behavior, what wert thou

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Till this madman show'd thee? and what art thou now?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Re-enter the PRINCESS, ushered by BOYET, ROSALINE, MARIA, and KATHARINE

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: All hail, sweet madam, and fair time of day!

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: 'Fair' in 'all hail' is foul, as I conceive.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Construe my speeches better, if you may.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Then wish me better; I will give you leave.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: We came to visit you, and purpose now

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: To lead you to our court; vouchsafe it then.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: This field shall hold me; and so hold your vow:

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Nor God, nor I, delights in perjured men.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Rebuke me not for that which you provoke:

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: The virtue of your eye must break my oath.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: You nickname virtue; vice you should have spoke;

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: For virtue's office never breaks men's troth.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Now by my maiden honour, yet as pure

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: As the unsullied lily, I protest,

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: A world of torments though I should endure,

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: I would not yield to be your house's guest;

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: So much I hate a breaking cause to be

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Of heavenly oaths, vow'd with integrity.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: O, you have lived in desolation here,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Unseen, unvisited, much to our shame.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Not so, my lord; it is not so, I swear;

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: We have had pastimes here and pleasant game:

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: A mess of Russians left us but of late.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: How, madam! Russians!

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Ay, in truth, my lord;

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Trim gallants, full of courtship and of state.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Madam, speak true. It is not so, my lord:

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: My lady, to the manner of the days,

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: In courtesy gives undeserving praise.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: We four indeed confronted were with four

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: In Russian habit: here they stay'd an hour,

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: And talk'd apace; and in that hour, my lord,

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: They did not bless us with one happy word.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: I dare not call them fools; but this I think,

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: When they are thirsty, fools would fain have drink.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: This jest is dry to me. Fair gentle sweet,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Your wit makes wise things foolish: when we greet,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: With eyes best seeing, heaven's fiery eye,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: By light we lose light: your capacity

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Is of that nature that to your huge store

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Wise things seem foolish and rich things but poor.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: This proves you wise and rich, for in my eye,--

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: I am a fool, and full of poverty.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: But that you take what doth to you belong,

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: It were a fault to snatch words from my tongue.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: O, I am yours, and all that I possess!

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: All the fool mine?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: I cannot give you less.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Which of the vizards was it that you wore?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Where? when? what vizard? why demand you this?

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: There, then, that vizard; that superfluous case

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: That hid the worse and show'd the better face.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: We are descried; they'll mock us now downright.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Let us confess and turn it to a jest.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Amazed, my lord? why looks your highness sad?

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Help, hold his brows! he'll swoon! Why look you pale?

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Sea-sick, I think, coming from Muscovy.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Thus pour the stars down plagues for perjury.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Can any face of brass hold longer out?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: lady, dart thy skill at me;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Bruise me with scorn, confound me with a flout;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Thrust thy sharp wit quite through my ignorance;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Cut me to pieces with thy keen conceit;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And I will wish thee never more to dance,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Nor never more in Russian habit wait.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: O, never will I trust to speeches penn'd,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Nor to the motion of a schoolboy's tongue,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Nor never come in vizard to my friend,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Nor woo in rhyme, like a blind harper's song!

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Taffeta phrases, silken terms precise,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Three-piled hyperboles, spruce affectation,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Figures pedantical; these summer-flies

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Have blown me full of maggot ostentation:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: I do forswear them; and I here protest,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: By this white glove;--how white the hand, God knows!--

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Henceforth my wooing mind shall be express'd

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: In russet yeas and honest kersey noes:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And, to begin, wench,--so God help me, la!--

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: My love to thee is sound, sans crack or flaw.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Sans sans, I pray you.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Yet I have a trick

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Of the old rage: bear with me, I am sick;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: I'll leave it by degrees. Soft, let us see:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Write, 'Lord have mercy on us' on those three;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: They are infected; in their hearts it lies;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: They have the plague, and caught it of your eyes;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: These lords are visited; you are not free,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: For the Lord's tokens on you do I see.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: No, they are free that gave these tokens to us.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Our states are forfeit: seek not to undo us.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: It is not so; for how can this be true,

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: That you stand forfeit, being those that sue?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Peace! for I will not have to do with you.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Nor shall not, if I do as I intend.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Speak for yourselves; my wit is at an end.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Teach us, sweet madam, for our rude transgression

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Some fair excuse.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: The fairest is confession.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Were not you here but even now disguised?

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Madam, I was.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: And were you well advised?

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: I was, fair madam.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: When you then were here,

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: What did you whisper in your lady's ear?

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: That more than all the world I did respect her.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: When she shall challenge this, you will reject her.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Upon mine honour, no.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Peace, peace! forbear:

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Your oath once broke, you force not to forswear.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Despise me, when I break this oath of mine.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: I will: and therefore keep it. Rosaline,

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: What did the Russian whisper in your ear?

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Madam, he swore that he did hold me dear

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: As precious eyesight, and did value me

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Above this world; adding thereto moreover

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: That he would wed me, or else die my lover.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: God give thee joy of him! the noble lord

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Most honourably doth unhold his word.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: What mean you, madam? by my life, my troth,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: I never swore this lady such an oath.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: By heaven, you did; and to confirm it plain,

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: You gave me this: but take it, sir, again.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: My faith and this the princess I did give:

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: I knew her by this jewel on her sleeve.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Pardon me, sir, this jewel did she wear;

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: And Lord Biron, I thank him, is my dear.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: What, will you have me, or your pearl again?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Neither of either; I remit both twain.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: I see the trick on't: here was a consent,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Knowing aforehand of our merriment,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: To dash it like a Christmas comedy:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Some carry-tale, some please-man, some slight zany,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Some mumble-news, some trencher-knight, some Dick,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: That smiles his cheek in years and knows the trick

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: To make my lady laugh when she's disposed,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Told our intents before; which once disclosed,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: The ladies did change favours: and then we,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Following the signs, woo'd but the sign of she.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Now, to our perjury to add more terror,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: We are again forsworn, in will and error.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Much upon this it is: and might not you

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: To BOYET

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Forestall our sport, to make us thus untrue?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Do not you know my lady's foot by the squier,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And laugh upon the apple of her eye?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And stand between her back, sir, and the fire,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Holding a trencher, jesting merrily?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: You put our page out: go, you are allow'd;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Die when you will, a smock shall be your shroud.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: You leer upon me, do you? there's an eye

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Wounds like a leaden sword.

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Full merrily

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Hath this brave manage, this career, been run.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Lo, he is tilting straight! Peace! I have done.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Enter COSTARD

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Welcome, pure wit! thou partest a fair fray.

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: O Lord, sir, they would know

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: Whether the three Worthies shall come in or no.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: What, are there but three?

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: No, sir; but it is vara fine,

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: For every one pursents three.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And three times thrice is nine.

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: Not so, sir; under correction, sir; I hope it is not so.

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: You cannot beg us, sir, I can assure you, sir we know

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: what we know:

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: I hope, sir, three times thrice, sir,--

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Is not nine.

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: Under correction, sir, we know whereuntil it doth amount.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: By Jove, I always took three threes for nine.

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: O Lord, sir, it were pity you should get your living

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: by reckoning, sir.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: How much is it?

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: O Lord, sir, the parties themselves, the actors,

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: sir, will show whereuntil it doth amount: for mine

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: own part, I am, as they say, but to parfect one man

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: in one poor man, Pompion the Great, sir.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Art thou one of the Worthies?

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: It pleased them to think me worthy of Pompion the

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: Great: for mine own part, I know not the degree of

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: the Worthy, but I am to stand for him.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Go, bid them prepare.

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: We will turn it finely off, sir; we will take

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: some care.

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: Exit

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Biron, they will shame us: let them not approach.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: We are shame-proof, my lord: and tis some policy

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: To have one show worse than the king's and his company.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: I say they shall not come.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Nay, my good lord, let me o'errule you now:

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: That sport best pleases that doth least know how:

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Where zeal strives to content, and the contents

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Dies in the zeal of that which it presents:

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Their form confounded makes most form in mirth,

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: When great things labouring perish in their birth.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: A right description of our sport, my lord.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Enter DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Anointed, I implore so much expense of thy royal

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: sweet breath as will utter a brace of words.

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Converses apart with FERDINAND, and delivers him a paper

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Doth this man serve God?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Why ask you?

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: He speaks not like a man of God's making.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: That is all one, my fair, sweet, honey monarch; for,

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: I protest, the schoolmaster is exceeding

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: fantastical; too, too vain, too too vain: but we

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: will put it, as they say, to fortuna de la guerra.

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: I wish you the peace of mind, most royal couplement!

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Here is like to be a good presence of Worthies. He

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: presents Hector of Troy; the swain, Pompey the

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Great; the parish curate, Alexander; Armado's page,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Hercules; the pedant, Judas Maccabaeus: And if

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: these four Worthies in their first show thrive,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: These four will change habits, and present the other five.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: There is five in the first show.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: You are deceived; 'tis not so.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: The pedant, the braggart, the hedge-priest, the fool

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: and the boy:--

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Abate throw at novum, and the whole world again

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Cannot pick out five such, take each one in his vein.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: The ship is under sail, and here she comes amain.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Enter COSTARD, for Pompey

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: I Pompey am,--

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: You lie, you are not he.

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: I Pompey am,--

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: With libbard's head on knee.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Well said, old mocker: I must needs be friends

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: with thee.

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: I Pompey am, Pompey surnamed the Big--

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: The Great.

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: It is, 'Great,' sir:--

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: Pompey surnamed the Great;

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: That oft in field, with targe and shield, did make

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: my foe to sweat:

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: And travelling along this coast, I here am come by chance,

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: And lay my arms before the legs of this sweet lass of France,

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: If your ladyship would say, 'Thanks, Pompey,' I had done.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Great thanks, great Pompey.

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: 'Tis not so much worth; but I hope I was perfect: I

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: made a little fault in 'Great.'

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: My hat to a halfpenny, Pompey proves the best Worthy.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Enter SIR NATHANIEL, for Alexander

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: When in the world I lived, I was the world's

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: commander;

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: By east, west, north, and south, I spread my

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: conquering might:

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: My scutcheon plain declares that I am Alisander,--

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Your nose says, no, you are not for it stands too right.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Your nose smells 'no' in this, most tender-smelling knight.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: The conqueror is dismay'd. Proceed, good Alexander.

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: When in the world I lived, I was the world's

speaker: SIR NATHANIEL
text_entry: commander,--

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Most true, 'tis right; you were so, Alisander.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Pompey the Great,--

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: Your servant, and Costard.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Take away the conqueror, take away Alisander.

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: [To SIR NATHANIEL]  O, sir, you have overthrown

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: Alisander the conqueror! You will be scraped out of

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: the painted cloth for this: your lion, that holds

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: his poll-axe sitting on a close-stool, will be given

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: to Ajax: he will be the ninth Worthy. A conqueror,

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: and afeard to speak! run away for shame, Alisander.

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: SIR NATHANIEL retires

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: There, an't shall please you; a foolish mild man; an

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: honest man, look you, and soon dashed. He is a

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: marvellous good neighbour, faith, and a very good

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: bowler: but, for Alisander,--alas, you see how

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: 'tis,--a little o'erparted. But there are Worthies

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: a-coming will speak their mind in some other sort.

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: Enter HOLOFERNES, for Judas; and MOTH, for Hercules

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Great Hercules is presented by this imp,

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Whose club kill'd Cerberus, that three-headed canis;

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: And when he was a babe, a child, a shrimp,

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Thus did he strangle serpents in his manus.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Quoniam he seemeth in minority,

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Ergo I come with this apology.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Keep some state in thy exit, and vanish.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: MOTH retires

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Judas I am,--

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: A Judas!

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Not Iscariot, sir.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Judas I am, ycliped Maccabaeus.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Judas Maccabaeus clipt is plain Judas.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: A kissing traitor. How art thou proved Judas?

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Judas I am,--

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: The more shame for you, Judas.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: What mean you, sir?

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: To make Judas hang himself.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: Begin, sir; you are my elder.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Well followed: Judas was hanged on an elder.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: I will not be put out of countenance.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Because thou hast no face.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: What is this?

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: A cittern-head.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: The head of a bodkin.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: A Death's face in a ring.

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: The face of an old Roman coin, scarce seen.

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: The pommel of Caesar's falchion.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: The carved-bone face on a flask.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Saint George's half-cheek in a brooch.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Ay, and in a brooch of lead.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Ay, and worn in the cap of a tooth-drawer.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And now forward; for we have put thee in countenance.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: You have put me out of countenance.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: False; we have given thee faces.

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: But you have out-faced them all.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: An thou wert a lion, we would do so.

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Therefore, as he is an ass, let him go.

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: And so adieu, sweet Jude! nay, why dost thou stay?

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: For the latter end of his name.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: For the ass to the Jude; give it him:--Jud-as, away!

speaker: HOLOFERNES
text_entry: This is not generous, not gentle, not humble.

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: A light for Monsieur Judas! it grows dark, he may stumble.

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: HOLOFERNES retires

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Alas, poor Maccabaeus, how hath he been baited!

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Enter DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO, for Hector

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Hide thy head, Achilles: here comes Hector in arms.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Though my mocks come home by me, I will now be merry.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Hector was but a Troyan in respect of this.

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: But is this Hector?

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: I think Hector was not so clean-timbered.

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: His leg is too big for Hector's.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: More calf, certain.

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: No; he is best endued in the small.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: This cannot be Hector.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: He's a god or a painter; for he makes faces.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: The armipotent Mars, of lances the almighty,

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Gave Hector a gift,--

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: A gilt nutmeg.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: A lemon.

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: Stuck with cloves.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: No, cloven.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Peace!--

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: The armipotent Mars, of lances the almighty

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Gave Hector a gift, the heir of Ilion;

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: A man so breathed, that certain he would fight; yea

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: From morn till night, out of his pavilion.

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: I am that flower,--

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: That mint.

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: That columbine.

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Sweet Lord Longaville, rein thy tongue.

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: I must rather give it the rein, for it runs against Hector.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Ay, and Hector's a greyhound.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: The sweet war-man is dead and rotten; sweet chucks,

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: beat not the bones of the buried: when he breathed,

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: he was a man. But I will forward with my device.

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: To the PRINCESS

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Sweet royalty, bestow on me the sense of hearing.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Speak, brave Hector: we are much delighted.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: I do adore thy sweet grace's slipper.

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: [Aside to DUMAIN]  Loves her by the foot,--

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: [Aside to BOYET]  He may not by the yard.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: This Hector far surmounted Hannibal,--

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: The party is gone, fellow Hector, she is gone; she

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: is two months on her way.

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: What meanest thou?

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: Faith, unless you play the honest Troyan, the poor

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: wench is cast away: she's quick; the child brags in

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: her belly already: tis yours.

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Dost thou infamonize me among potentates? thou shalt

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: die.

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: Then shall Hector be whipped for Jaquenetta that is

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: quick by him and hanged for Pompey that is dead by

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: him.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Most rare Pompey!

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Renowned Pompey!

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Greater than great, great, great, great Pompey!

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Pompey the Huge!

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Hector trembles.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Pompey is moved. More Ates, more Ates! stir them

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: on! stir them on!

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Hector will challenge him.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Ay, if a' have no man's blood in's belly than will

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: sup a flea.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: By the north pole, I do challenge thee.

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: I will not fight with a pole, like a northern man:

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: I'll slash; I'll do it by the sword. I bepray you,

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: let me borrow my arms again.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Room for the incensed Worthies!

speaker: COSTARD
text_entry: I'll do it in my shirt.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Most resolute Pompey!

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: Master, let me take you a buttonhole lower. Do you

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: not see Pompey is uncasing for the combat? What mean

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: you? You will lose your reputation.

speaker: MOTH
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Gentlemen and soldiers, pardon me; I will not combat

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: in my shirt.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: You may not deny it: Pompey hath made the challenge.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Sweet bloods, I both may and will.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: What reason have you for't?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: The naked truth of it is, I have no shirt; I go

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: woolward for penance.

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: True, and it was enjoined him in Rome for want of

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: linen: since when, I'll be sworn, he wore none but

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: a dishclout of Jaquenetta's, and that a' wears next

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: his heart for a favour.

speaker: BOYET
text_entry: Enter MERCADE

speaker: MERCADE
text_entry: God save you, madam!

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Welcome, Mercade;

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: But that thou interrupt'st our merriment.

speaker: MERCADE
text_entry: I am sorry, madam; for the news I bring

speaker: MERCADE
text_entry: Is heavy in my tongue. The king your father--

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Dead, for my life!

speaker: MERCADE
text_entry: Even so; my tale is told.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Worthies, away! the scene begins to cloud.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: For mine own part, I breathe free breath. I have

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: seen the day of wrong through the little hole of

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: discretion, and I will right myself like a soldier.

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Exeunt Worthies

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: How fares your majesty?

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Boyet, prepare; I will away tonight.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Madam, not so; I do beseech you, stay.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Prepare, I say. I thank you, gracious lords,

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: For all your fair endeavors; and entreat,

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Out of a new-sad soul, that you vouchsafe

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: In your rich wisdom to excuse or hide

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: The liberal opposition of our spirits,

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: If over-boldly we have borne ourselves

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: In the converse of breath: your gentleness

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Was guilty of it. Farewell worthy lord!

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: A heavy heart bears not a nimble tongue:

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Excuse me so, coming too short of thanks

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: For my great suit so easily obtain'd.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: The extreme parts of time extremely forms

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: All causes to the purpose of his speed,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: And often at his very loose decides

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: That which long process could not arbitrate:

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: And though the mourning brow of progeny

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Forbid the smiling courtesy of love

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: The holy suit which fain it would convince,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Yet, since love's argument was first on foot,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Let not the cloud of sorrow justle it

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: From what it purposed; since, to wail friends lost

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Is not by much so wholesome-profitable

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: As to rejoice at friends but newly found.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: I understand you not: my griefs are double.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Honest plain words best pierce the ear of grief;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And by these badges understand the king.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: For your fair sakes have we neglected time,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Play'd foul play with our oaths: your beauty, ladies,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Hath much deform'd us, fashioning our humours

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Even to the opposed end of our intents:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And what in us hath seem'd ridiculous,--

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: As love is full of unbefitting strains,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: All wanton as a child, skipping and vain,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Form'd by the eye and therefore, like the eye,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Full of strange shapes, of habits and of forms,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Varying in subjects as the eye doth roll

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: To every varied object in his glance:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Which parti-coated presence of loose love

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Put on by us, if, in your heavenly eyes,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Have misbecomed our oaths and gravities,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Those heavenly eyes, that look into these faults,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Suggested us to make. Therefore, ladies,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Our love being yours, the error that love makes

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Is likewise yours: we to ourselves prove false,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: By being once false for ever to be true

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: To those that make us both,--fair ladies, you:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: And even that falsehood, in itself a sin,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Thus purifies itself and turns to grace.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: We have received your letters full of love;

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Your favours, the ambassadors of love;

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: And, in our maiden council, rated them

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: At courtship, pleasant jest and courtesy,

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: As bombast and as lining to the time:

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: But more devout than this in our respects

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Have we not been; and therefore met your loves

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: In their own fashion, like a merriment.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: Our letters, madam, show'd much more than jest.

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: So did our looks.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: We did not quote them so.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Now, at the latest minute of the hour,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Grant us your loves.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: A time, methinks, too short

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: To make a world-without-end bargain in.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: No, no, my lord, your grace is perjured much,

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Full of dear guiltiness; and therefore this:

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: If for my love, as there is no such cause,

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: You will do aught, this shall you do for me:

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Your oath I will not trust; but go with speed

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: To some forlorn and naked hermitage,

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Remote from all the pleasures of the world;

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: There stay until the twelve celestial signs

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Have brought about the annual reckoning.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: If this austere insociable life

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Change not your offer made in heat of blood;

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: If frosts and fasts, hard lodging and thin weeds

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Nip not the gaudy blossoms of your love,

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: But that it bear this trial and last love;

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Then, at the expiration of the year,

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Come challenge me, challenge me by these deserts,

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: And, by this virgin palm now kissing thine

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: I will be thine; and till that instant shut

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: My woeful self up in a mourning house,

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Raining the tears of lamentation

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: For the remembrance of my father's death.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: If this thou do deny, let our hands part,

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Neither entitled in the other's heart.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: If this, or more than this, I would deny,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: To flatter up these powers of mine with rest,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: The sudden hand of death close up mine eye!

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Hence ever then my heart is in thy breast.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: But what to me, my love? but what to me? A wife?

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: A beard, fair health, and honesty;

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: With three-fold love I wish you all these three.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: O, shall I say, I thank you, gentle wife?

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: Not so, my lord; a twelvemonth and a day

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: I'll mark no words that smooth-faced wooers say:

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: Come when the king doth to my lady come;

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: Then, if I have much love, I'll give you some.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: I'll serve thee true and faithfully till then.

speaker: KATHARINE
text_entry: Yet swear not, lest ye be forsworn again.

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: What says Maria?

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: At the twelvemonth's end

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: I'll change my black gown for a faithful friend.

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text_entry: I'll stay with patience; but the time is long.

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: The liker you; few taller are so young.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Studies my lady? mistress, look on me;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Behold the window of my heart, mine eye,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: What humble suit attends thy answer there:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Impose some service on me for thy love.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Oft have I heard of you, my Lord Biron,

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Before I saw you; and the world's large tongue

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Proclaims you for a man replete with mocks,

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Full of comparisons and wounding flouts,

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Which you on all estates will execute

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: That lie within the mercy of your wit.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: To weed this wormwood from your fruitful brain,

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: And therewithal to win me, if you please,

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Without the which I am not to be won,

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: You shall this twelvemonth term from day to day

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Visit the speechless sick and still converse

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: With groaning wretches; and your task shall be,

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: With all the fierce endeavor of your wit

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: To enforce the pained impotent to smile.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: To move wild laughter in the throat of death?

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: It cannot be; it is impossible:

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Mirth cannot move a soul in agony.

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Why, that's the way to choke a gibing spirit,

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Whose influence is begot of that loose grace

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Which shallow laughing hearers give to fools:

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: A jest's prosperity lies in the ear

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Of him that hears it, never in the tongue

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Of him that makes it: then, if sickly ears,

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Deaf'd with the clamours of their own dear groans,

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Will hear your idle scorns, continue then,

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: And I will have you and that fault withal;

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: But if they will not, throw away that spirit,

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: And I shall find you empty of that fault,

speaker: ROSALINE
text_entry: Right joyful of your reformation.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: A twelvemonth! well; befall what will befall,

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: I'll jest a twelvemonth in an hospital.

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: [To FERDINAND]  Ay, sweet my lord; and so I take my leave.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: No, madam; we will bring you on your way.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Our wooing doth not end like an old play;

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Jack hath not Jill: these ladies' courtesy

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Might well have made our sport a comedy.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Come, sir, it wants a twelvemonth and a day,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: And then 'twill end.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: That's too long for a play.

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: Re-enter DON ADRIANO DE ARMADO

speaker: BIRON
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Sweet majesty, vouchsafe me,--

speaker: PRINCESS
text_entry: Was not that Hector?

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: The worthy knight of Troy.

speaker: DUMAIN
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: I will kiss thy royal finger, and take leave. I am

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: a votary; I have vowed to Jaquenetta to hold the

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: plough for her sweet love three years. But, most

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: esteemed greatness, will you hear the dialogue that

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: the two learned men have compiled in praise of the

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: owl and the cuckoo? It should have followed in the

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: end of our show.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Call them forth quickly; we will do so.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Holla! approach.

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Re-enter HOLOFERNES, SIR NATHANIEL, MOTH, COSTARD, and others

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: This side is Hiems, Winter, this Ver, the Spring;

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: the one maintained by the owl, the other by the

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: cuckoo. Ver, begin.

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: THE SONG

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: SPRING.

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: When daisies pied and violets blue

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: And lady-smocks all silver-white

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: And cuckoo-buds of yellow hue

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Do paint the meadows with delight,

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: The cuckoo then, on every tree,

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Mocks married men; for thus sings he,  Cuckoo;

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Cuckoo, cuckoo: O word of fear,

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Unpleasing to a married ear!

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: When shepherds pipe on oaten straws

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: And merry larks are ploughmen's clocks,

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: When turtles tread, and rooks, and daws,

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: And maidens bleach their summer smocks

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: The cuckoo then, on every tree,

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Mocks married men; for thus sings he,  Cuckoo;

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Cuckoo, cuckoo: O word of fear,

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Unpleasing to a married ear!

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: WINTER.

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: When icicles hang by the wall

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: And Dick the shepherd blows his nail

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: And Tom bears logs into the hall

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: And milk comes frozen home in pail,

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: When blood is nipp'd and ways be foul,

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Then nightly sings the staring owl,  Tu-whit;

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Tu-who, a merry note,

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: While greasy Joan doth keel the pot.

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: When all aloud the wind doth blow

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: And coughing drowns the parson's saw

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: And birds sit brooding in the snow

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: And Marian's nose looks red and raw,

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: When roasted crabs hiss in the bowl,

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Then nightly sings the staring owl,  Tu-whit;

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Tu-who, a merry note,

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: While greasy Joan doth keel the pot.

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: DON

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: The words of Mercury are harsh after the songs of

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Apollo. You that way: we this way.

speaker: ADRIANO DE ARMADO
text_entry: Exeunt
